clinical_study.brief_title: FEIBA to Optimize Postcardiopulmonary Bypass Hemostasis in Pediatric Cardiac Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Activated Prothrombin Complex Concentrate FEIBA to Optimize Postcardiopulomonary Bypass Hemostasis in Pediatric Cardiac Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to understand if the medication called FEIBA helps to stop bleeding and decrease transfusion of blood products to small children operated on the heart.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of units of allogeneic blood products required early perioperatively in pediatric cardiac patients.
primary_outcome.description: Number of units of transfused allogeneic blood products after cardiopulmonary bypass in the operating room (OR) and in the intensive care unit (ICU) on postoperative day (POD) 0 and 1.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of days admitted to the hospital
Number of subjects to experience intravascular and/or intracardiac thromboses up to POD 3

arm_group.description: Pediatric patients ≤15 kg of weight, undergoing cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass will receive activated prothrombin complex concentrate (aPCC) FEIBA to be incorporated into standard treatment of post-bypass coagulopathic bleeding.
Pediatric patients ≤15 kg of weight, undergoing cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass will receive a placebo to be incorporated into standard treatment of post-bypass coagulopathic bleeding.

intervention.description: Administered via the central line catheter after termination of cardiopulmonary bypass if bleeding related to poor clotting develops; in addition, according to conventional protocol blood products will be transfused simultaneously. Three small doses, 5 mg/kg each, will be available.

Contains no active ingredient and administered via the central line catheter after termination of cardiopulmonary bypass if bleeding related to poor clotting develops; in addition, according to conventional protocol blood products will be transfused simultaneously.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Weight ≤ 15 kg.
- Elective cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass.
- Coagulopathic bleeding after cardiopulmonary bypass.
- Availability and willingness of the parent/legal guardian to provide informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of mechanical circulatory support at the time of randomization or POD 0 and 1.
- Patient or family history of coagulopathy and/or thromboses.
- Preoperative anticoagulation (excluding low dose heparin for "line prophylaxis").
